$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Propargylation of Aliphatic Thiols (4a-c) with
Propargylic Carbonate (1a). A mixture of propargylic carbonate (1a, 1.0
mmol), aliphatic thiol (4, 1.2 mmol), CpRuCl(PPh3)2 (0.030 mmol), and
N-methylpiperidine (3.0 mL) was placed in a two-necked 20-mL Pyrex flask
equipped with a magnetic stirring bar under a flow of argon. The reaction
was carried out at 100°C for 8 h with stirring. After the reaction
mixture was cooled, the products were isolated by column chromatography
(Florisil® (60-100 mesh), eluent: pentane/ethyl acetate (50/1 in v/v)).
Pentyl 3-phenylprop-2-ynyl sulfide (5b). Colorless liquid, yield 95% bp
70-80°C (5.0 mmHg, Kugelrohr); IR (neat) 1442, 2254, 2927 cm-1; 1H NMR
(CDCl3, 300 MHz): δ 0.90 (t,3H, J=6.84 Hz), 1.30-1.45 (m, 4H), 1.67
(quintet, 2H, J=7.32 Hz), 2.73 (t, 2H, J=7.32 Hz), 3.49 (s, 2H),
7.20-7.41 (m, 5H); 13C NMR (CDCl3, 75 MHz): δ 14.0, 20.3, 22.3, 28.8,
31.1, 31.8, 82.8, 85.6, 123.1, 128.0, 128.1, 131.6; MS (EI) m/z 218 (M+).
Anal. Calcd for C14H18S: C 77.01, H 8.31. Found: C 76.97, H 8.47. Exact
mass calcd for C14H18S: 218.1129. Found: 218.1124.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Ruthenium-catalyzed S-propargylation of thiols enables the rapid
synthesis of propargylic sulfides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru

$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM 2632-99-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Synthesis of Esters
from Thiols. To a stirred mixture of 4,4′-azopyridine (1.2 mmol, 0.216 g)
and acid (1 mmol) in dry CH3CN (3 mL) was added a solution of PPh3 (0.312
g, 1.2 mmol) and thiol (1.3 mmol) in acetonitrile. The reaction mixture
was reﬂuxed for several hours. After completion of the reaction, the
produced pyridine hydrazine was ﬁltered and the solution was concentrated
on a rotary evaporator to give a viscous oil. After puriﬁcation using a
short column of silica gel, the product was obtained. Compound 5c. 5c:
1H-NMR (250 MHz, CDCl3) δ (ppm): 7.89-7.30 (5H, m), 2.97 (2H, t, J = 7.2
Hz), 1.58-1.55 (2H, m), 1.34-1.27 (4H, m), 0.82 (3H, t, J = 6.5 Hz);
13C-NMR (62.9 MHz, CDCl3) δ (ppm): 192.0, 137.3, 135.5, 134.2, 133.2,
130.5, 128.4, 31.0, 29.6, 28.9, 22.2, 13.9.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Mitsunobu reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Easily Prepared Azopyridines As Potent and Recyclable Reagents for Facile
Esterification Reactions. An Efficient Modified Mitsunobu Reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Iranpoor, Nasser; Firouzabadi, Habib; Khalili, Dariush; Motevalli,
Somayeh
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2008), 73(13), 4882-4887

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 942283-78-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 664985-99-3
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 110-66-7
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951343-76-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16084333
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME150 STEP1
$RXN

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 942283-78-5

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 110-66-7
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16082854
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of

respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences

pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Preparation of
2-(Thymin-1'-ylmethoxy)ethyl Alkyl Sulfides (6) To a suspension of 0.312
g (6.5 mmol) of 50% NaH in THF (15 mL), 6 mmol of RSH at 0°C was added
dropwise. The reaction mixture was warmed to room temperature and stirred
for 2 h, and then 0.67 g (3 mmol) of 5 was added to the reaction mixture
and stirring was continued for 5 h. The resultant mixture was adjusted to
pH = 6-7 with 1 M HCl and was extracted with CHCl3 (3 x 50 mL). The
organic layers were combined and dried over MgSO4. The solvent was
removed in vacuo and the residue then was purified by flash
chromatography on silica-gel (CHCl3: CH3OH = 20:1) to give 6. 6e, yield
95%. m.p. 90-91°C. 1H MNR (CDCl3) δ : 0.87 (t, J = 7.2 Hz, 3H), 1.22-1.68
(m, 6H), 1.92 (s, 3H), 2.50 (t, J = 7.4 Hz, 2H), 2.68 (t, J = 6.4 Hz,
2H), 3.70 (t, 2H, J = 6.4 Hz), 5.14 (s, 2H), 7.13 (s, 1H), 8.41 (s, 1H).
IR (KBr Disc): 3415, 3058, 2954, 2865, 1721, 1683, 1630, 1455, 1268,
1129, 831, 555 cm-1. Anal, cacld. for C13H22N2O3S: C, 54.52; H, 7.74; N,
9.78. Found: C, 54.63; H, 7.75; N, 9.69.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

alkyl sulfides and their oxidation products

$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM 951343-63-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16088549

$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2

$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2

the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Reaction of [Cp2Zr(THF-d 8)(O(tBuO)C=CMe2)][MeB(C6F5)3] (1-d 8) with
tBuSH in THF-d 8: Generation of [Cp2Zr(THF-d 8)(StBu)][MeB(C6F5)3] (4-d
8). B(C6F5)3 (25.8 mg, 0.05 mmol) was added at room temperature to a
solution of Cp2Zr(Me)(O(tBuO)C=CMe2) (19.1 mg, 0.05 mmol) in THFd 8 (ca.
0.5 mL) in a Teflon-valved NMR tube. The solution was left for 10 min at
room temperature to ensure complete formation of 1-d 8 , and then tBuSH
(4.5 mg, 0.05 mmol) was added via a microsyringe. No color change of the
pale brown solution was noticed. 1H NMR spectra were periodically
recorded and revealed that the reaction was finished within 1.5 h to give
4-d 8 in 95% NMR yield.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM 95% NMR yield, not isolated

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-244-CAS-16086539
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C04E25, yield 95%. MW: 505.69
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME173 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 27007-77-8

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 111-31-9
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951345-10-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16084071
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME175 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound

of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of

respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16076516
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release

5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of

respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C06E25, yield 95%. MW: 519.67

$DATUM 111-31-9
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951344-08-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16076303

$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction

$DATUM 4

$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0

$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C20E25, yield 95%. MW: 535.72
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 27007-77-8

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16082356
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME190 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

M  V30 1 C 5.3348 0.7700 0.0 0

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 80472-30-6

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04
